Also I ordered fries and those were spicy and I was not expecting those to be spicy. So when I do go I order their cheesesteak with no seasoning with extra meat and I am satisfied.  This place I keep visiting and getting the same thing.

mmmmm yummy carb overload.  I came here twice and came here for the chicken philly steak.  it was delicious!  i seriously need to try the beef next time.  It had onion, mushroom and cheese on it.  yummy melted cheese.  mmmm i can see it now... making me hungry all over again.  So if you are watching your carb intake then you don't want to come here but if you want a great sandwich then this is the place to come.  everything is made to order so it's fresh off the grill.
Very clean friendly family owned Halal food joint of my choice my family likes to visit this place always great place to eat

I have to say I have NEVER had an authentic Philly before, but I've had many Vegas versions.  There are many varieties out there, some drier than others, some smothered in cheese, and almost all of them undercook the green pepper if you ask for it.  THIS place, however, has my favorite Philly yet.  The meat is flavorful, the bread is grilled and delicious, and they use a reasonable amount of cheese.  What's more, their seasoned steak fries are a perfect complement to the sandwich.  The guys who run the place are super nice too; unlike many places in town they act like they truly appreciate your business.  I only have 2 complaints: you WILL leave smelling like onion if you wait for your food and I do wish they would go to fountain drinks instead of canned/bottled sodas.  Regardless, this is my go-to for a Philly in the NW!

Still haven't had a philly steak from this place but their salads and kabob plates are really good but the gyro salad is my favorite so far. The customer service is always on point and they are nice! I seen people getting the philly steak and it looked delicious. I recommend this place.

Best Philly i've had in Vegas!!! I got the philly cheese steak sandwich combo. Came with a fresh made to order philly cheese steak, a side of seasoned steak fries and a drink. Price is very reasonable. They also have chicken phillies and gyros. Will try a different item next time but hands down the philly steak has been one of the best I have tried. The owners are very friendly also. Give this place a try!!!

So far I would rate this as the best Philly steak sandwich I have had in town. Nice size portions that don't leave you completely bloated after eating and cooked to order. Staff was friendly and it seems evident that the staff of the small business do what it takes to win over repeat customers. Prices are quite reasonable as we'll with a combo meal just under $10. I would say it is definitely worth checking this place out if you are craving Philly Steak sandwiches or Gyros.

I like this place a lot. I think they have the best kebab in town. The beef gyro is also really good. They are called philly steak express because they offer other kinds of food other than middle eastern. I haven't tried any of the other foods, but that is soon to come. I have had issues with calling them at times to order food as I would get a busy tone. They may have fixed this issue now.
Awesome service, terrific lamb gyros as it should be, I love the fries! Military discount due to them being veterans!
This place has yet to disappoint me. The lamb gryo is cooked perfect everytime. The staff is friendly and it's very clean. My picky son likes the nuggets.

This is my go to spot for great freshly hot made a-la-carte sandwiches. Portions are very generous, and not to mention tasty meats marinated nicely. Anything on the menu is fantastic. My go to items are philly cheese steaks  and their Gyros are amazing.

This restaurant is under new management and I can definitely tell. Myra greets you with a smile and is pleasant throughout my whole visit. Most importantly the food is fantastic and came out in a timely manner. Highly recommend the gyro and Philly steak.
They aren't fighting amongst themselves which is good. It is as slow as can be but the cheesesteaks are good.

Love their cheese steaks. Suggestion: if you have a special order. (Ex- no mushroom, extra cheese) write it down for them. I think they are still learning English...but I'm impressed. They were so so nice. Better than other competitors' cheesesteaks!

We love the food here!  We come at least once a week and have brought a few friends too. My son loves the philly. I love love love the burger!  It has seasoned meat, yummo!  All of us love the gyro.  Great fries. It's always busy. Really good prices, good portions.
Discovered this place hile driving around. Philly Steak is freaky good and made from scratch so there's about 10 min wait. Wifey and I shared the foot long. She said its better than sex.....ouch!

I've been coming to Philly Steak Express since they have opened. The staff is always very friendly and they don't have any issue with customizing my sandwich. I like to add lettuce, tomatoes and other items to my philly and this place doesn't charge extra for these items. I really like this policy.    The portion size is always huge and I usually cannot finish the entire sandwich with fries. Speaking of their fries, they are delicious. The seasoning is perfect on the piping hot steak fries!  This place is always clean except for one thing that I've noticed this morning. I went at around 11 when they opened and I've noticed that both trash bins were full. There is no way that this many customers ate in the morning. Most likely, the nighttime staff didn't throw out the trash. This is unacceptable.  In any case, the food is always good here and I'll return. One other thing to mention is that they have both a television and radio station playing at the same time. This is very distracting. Perhaps turn the volume off on one.

This place has some of the best philly steaks in Vegas: guaranteed! The gyros are amazing too! I love this place but it's so hidden in that little business complex next to the 7/11 and butcher store, but it's a hidden gem that's worth visiting. Yeah it's a tiny bit pricy in my opinion, but worth every penny because I can't think of a better place to get a Philly Steak! I love it.

My boyfriend and I had low expectations coming into this place but we live around the corner and we had coupons! I am from philly so I know a decent cheese steak when I eat one. This was very good for a west coast cheese steak! I asked for no seasoning after reading prior reviews about the spice being too much. There was a lot of meat in the sandwich and the bread was very airy and good!!! The fires were very good and I liked the seasoning on them! We also had a beef gyro & that was really good too! Some bites had a little too much seasoning but still tasty. Food was very good & we will definitely be back!!
Great philly wrap and fresh chicken wings! Nice people.  Place was clean and inviting

Ever since the first time I came to this place I have absolutely loved the food I come back every week for the New York Burger combination and I believe it's the best burger in town. The owners and workers are all very nice the menu is very good and the restaurant is clean and the hours work for me.

I've gone here multiple times & have never been disappointed! I've never personally ordered the philly, but I've had bites! Its good. I loveeee the steak gyros though. They're so fresh & amazing  the bread is always so soft and fresh, the meat always has great flavor and is soft, not chewy. The fries come with a seasoning that is good in moderation. They can have a heavy hand on the fry seasoning but its good! Has a little spice to it but not much. Just gives the fries good flavor. 
I've ordered their chicken fingers before and those were amazing as well. I was pleasantly shocked. They're ranch is creamy goodness  
I recommend if you're in the area looking for a yummy spot to try! 
Dont expect fast service because you will wait about 10-20 mins for your food. But its sooooo worth it!!

Indescribable Philly cheesesteak sandwiches. My partner and I get eat them on our lazy nights in and we wish we could eat here more often. The sandwiches are pricey and that's the only thing holding us back from eating here every night. The staff is super friendly and the wait isn't long at all. It's all fresh.
Good food, love the Philly cheese steaks, the support the troops decor, and classic Americana makes for a good atmosphere too.

We went here after realizing that the food trucks that are usually at Fort Apache and Sunset on Friday nights, were at first Friday. I'm glad we made this choice! We got chicken fingers, a philly beef and a beef gyro and everything was excellent. The chicken fingers had a light batter and they were very moist and tender. The philly beef was tender, very well seasoned, just cheesy enough without being overwhelming and the portions of meat were generous! The gyro was also very delicious (maybe a little bit too much tzatziki sauce). The fries were thick but nicely seasoned, I usually don't like thick fries but these were lightly crunchy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside; they weren't dense.  The staff was friendly and the food came fairly quickly. We will definitely be going back!

Amazing assortment of food, if you haven't tried the food drop everything your doing and go get yourself the best sandwich in Vegas and my favorite the famous philly cheese steak. Forget all the fake shops around town this is the only good quality spot around vegas. Get get yourself some real food.

Food quality is terrible. Philly steak was bland, cook got the order wrong and took him 30 minutes to correct. I know what a real philly steak tastes like and you won't find anything remotely close to that at this establishment.  Dining experience as a whole was terrible. Not returning.

I have ate a ton of cheesesteaks in my day. I have tried damn near all of them in Las Vegas. I used to eat Pops or Triple Play. They were good but when I found Philly Steak Express I was knocked out. There cheesesteaks have so much favor. The cheese melts in your mouth. The steak has a very subtle spice that suprises you when you bite it. The bread is soft with a nice flavor. Fresh cut mushrooms was a great bonus.  So happy they didn't come from a can. The onions are fresh also and cooked into the meat providing a nice combo. The fries are thick steak fries with a nice seasoning. The service is outstanding. They are fast and friendly and always make conversation with there guests. Try them out. You will not be disappointed.

I eat here a time or two a month because it's conveniently located between work and home. They have great food that is made fresh, to order. I love their fries with spicy ketchup and their sandwiches are so filling! The woman at the counter is really sweet too. I usually get my food to go for convenience, but also because everything in the restaurant needs a really good cleaning. The doors, especially usually need a thorough wipe down. If it weren't for that, I'd probably eat here weekly and weigh a lot more.. Check it out. You're tummy will be happy!

I would have loved to review this place but they were supposed to be open at 10:00 am and were not.  Got there at 10:15 am and doors locked but open sign blinking on and off.  They didn't even answer the phone.  Went next door and got a sandwich instead and when we left the deli, the Philly Express store was open.  Shameful.

This place was reccomended to me by my boss. I recently moved here at the beginning of the year and was looking for a quick gyro shop to go to. You would never guess by the name that they have gyros though. lol. The guys that work there don't talk very much. They just take your order and get your food done.  It's efficient. 

I really like this place for the gyros --I like to think I know my gyros as well... I've traveled to various places in Greece and the bread that they use is very on par with that.  The meat is very juicy and succulent.  I also enjoy the taziki sauce.  It's more cucumber flavored than dill -which I don't mind. My SO always orders the Philly Cheese Steaks and he says they're fairly delicious too.  The service is alright and the tables are a little sticky.  It's just a little hole in the wall place to get your food though, so you really shouldn't expect the best of the best.  This is a great place for what it is. It's quick and great food.  We generally like to get take away here.

What a great little find! It's a small little sandwich shop near Tropicana and Fort Apache. No, it's nothing fancy but the food is excellent and the service is super friendly! I hard time deciding between a gyro or a cheesesteak but decided the place had to be named after its best dish. The beef cheesesteak was delicious. The bread was soft and fluffy, the onions and mushrooms were perfectly sautéed and the steak meat was tender and juicy. Simply perfect! Plus it came out super quick. Think this is a great place to pick up a quick lunch. 

Friendly service, quick food and yummy sandwiches? Yep! I can't wait to go back. I'll have to give their gyros a try next time.

I've been coming here quite often since they opened. And while I am not accustomed to a Philly steak from Philly, I must say I'm very satisfied with their rendition, meaty,  flavorful, and cheesy blanketed by a moist hoggie.  And when I'm feeling nelstolgic I go for a Gyro, which takes me back to the Imbiss in Germany where I would get a Döner.  Staff is friendly and welcoming.  And if steak is not for you, they have tender juicy chicken and Greek salads. A must try for all.

Kabobs with rice! that is the only thing on this menu I would suggest. The salad is horrible. Which a salad should be easy. The chicken fingers don't waste your time. We've tried this place 3 times because the kabobs are good. But all other dishes were a waste of time. The Philly cheese steak is ok not fabulous.

Been here a few times and seems like we always get a gyro combo and 10wings med. And its always been delicious!! Would of given the place 5 stars but for some reason when eating in this place it doesnt vent very well inside and we always leave smelling like greese and smoke! Even if we just take out it seems that way too. Other than that the food has always been good no complaints there!
2nd time here and the food has been great. Service is always good and the place is always clean. If you want a gyro or philly steak...kabobs this is a good spot on the southwest side of town.

The boyfriend and I took our dog to get groomed right next door and decided to stop in and have a Philly Cheese Steak. The shop was nice and we'll kept I think they recently opened. The menu is simple with a couple different items available ala carte or in a combo. For a philly cheese steak (w/cheese,mushrooms,and onions), fries, and a drink we only paid $7.99 each for the combo, which I thought was reasonably priced. The staff was friendly and it seemed like a family owned restaurant. They cook your food to order and they call you when it's ready. The sandwich was hot and fresh and it was really good.  The bread was phenomenal lightly toasted and soft. The sandwich was by far the best I have ever had. They served us two kinds of fries, steak fries and crinkle cut with I think a Cajun seasoning. The only downside about our visit was that half our fries were cold and it seemed as if they mixed the fresh fries with the old. My boyfriend was a little upset with the lack of fries but I thought there was plenty as I was full once I was done.
Love the food everybody in their super nice make you feel like you are Family and the food is always fresh
The Philly Cheese steak was excellent. The gyros were delicious as well. The service was fast and friendly.  Will come back again.

I'm really conflicted because the food was absolutely amazing, but this place comes no where near "express". We waited about 30 minutes for a gyro and a philly cheese steak, there were only two other guests in front of us so in no way should it have taken that long. Once the food came it was nice and hot, you could tell it came fresh off the grill and the fries were perfectly crispy with a yummy seasoning on top. That's one really good thing about this place and probably why the the wait is a little longer, all the meat is super fresh and cooked to order. I will be returning for sure but maybe placing an order in advance over the phone.

Stereotypical hole-in-the-wall place with great food.  The Philly Cheese steak was amazing and the Gyro was good as well.  Felt a little pricey at a bit over $8 per sandwich after taxes but not completely unreasonable and it tasted good so that's the most important thing.
My husband went here for lunch today and he can't stop talking about how great it is. The best gyro he's had by far since we moved to Vegas 3 yrs ago!

Based on good and lukewarm reviews, I went in here to try a Gyro and Fries. I have to agree with the lukewarm people about the taste of the food. The fries were okay, the flavoring didn't balance the thick starchy nature of the fries. The Gyro was also tasty but very salty. The salt, I believe is coming from the way the meat was prepared. I will probably try it again later to see if my opinion changes. Overall not amazing but not bad! Definitely good for a quick bite.

Thought I'd try this place. Super slow the employees here move like they have no life in them. I order the #1 with fries and drink. Which is clearly stated on their menu board. The employee has the audacity to lie to me and say we didn't order any fries and the #1 only comes with drinks. Please don't go here if you want to get conned. What I don't like is that they leave their ranch out and it's luke warm after being refrigerated. Nothing was stocked there. No forks. Food wise I've had better.

Had the Beef Cheesesteak and it was delicious. The beef tasted great and the bun was super soft. The steak fries were great too, loved the seasoning. Will definitely come back... 

.... Keep coming back. One of my favorite lunch spots now.

We love the Philly cheesesteak wraps, but they have cut back BIG TIME on the fries!!! They use to give you a decent portion of fries now they give you a very small portion! Get ready to wait for your food too! They are so slow. They only cook one order at a time. The food is good, but if I see a few people in there I go somewhere else! It's good but not worth the extremely long wait times!

Food is good.  Portion sizes are on the smaller side.  I'd grant more stars if it weren't for the poor service.  What I'm about to describe has happened to me numerous times here, and I've witnessed it happen to countless others as well... people who order well after I do often get served way ahead of me.  My order is generally for one person, max of two people, and the item(s) ordered are always simple -- not to mention, sometimes, exactly the same as what others behind me end up ordering.  And yet they get served first.  This happens all the time here.  

Will likely not return...unless I see an "under new management" sign.

I ordered a chicken kabob and fries it was not worth the $11.  When I was ordering the guy charging me kept  going to the grill to cook the food. I'm like, you gonna charge me or cook the food?! It's my second time at this place  they take too long to serve even though there is 2 customers here.

It was mine and my bf first time here, only came because his mom and sister said it was a good place so we decided to give it a shot. I'm sorry but when you post a picture of white tender chicken and when you get bits of brown greasy chicken in front of you instead and it's not what it looks like in the photo that's false advertisement. On top of that the food made me, my bf, and his mom sick about an hour later. Chicken was horrible, gyros not up to par, customer service was not good at all. Nightmare experience overall, what do you expect when you try and mix Philly's and gyros in one shot. Your doing too much.

This is my favorite place to get philly cheese steaks, gyros, and kabob! The service is fast and the workers are so friendly! They make everything from scratch so the food is always fresh. There is outdoor and indoor seating. They can cater from 10-40 people if you reserve ahead of time. Again, this place is a great place to grab lunch and dinner! I will definitely be back :)

Fabulous...food is fantastic here. Always fresh and made to order. I always get the $9.99 special..Philly Cheesesteak, steak fries and a drink. The steak fries are cooked perfectly. I can't say enough about this place. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Restaurant is very clean. Try it one time and I know you will be back.
They give a good amount of food for a reasonable price. The philly steaks are pretty good, and their spice adds a nice kick to it.
The staff was friendly. Food was delicious!! Just the timing to make it was a little longer than expected. But overall I am satisfied! Will definitely come back

I had been here twice but will not go again.  The Philly cheesesteak was fine, but the salad was below average.  The mix salad had an odd combination of some canned veggies and didn't live up to expectation.

Ultimately, I am not going back because of the service I received trying to get a free cup of water to go with my meal.  I went back and forth with both the guy at the counter and the manager as they kept trying to make me buy a bottle of water instead of drinking from the tap.  I even offered to pay a small fee just for a regular fountain cup and they still wouldn't budge.  They insisted I pay full price for the big cup, even though I was just getting water.  They mentioned that the water at the fountain was somehow "bad" but the sodas were fine.  Don't they know that the fountain soda has the same water in it??  I finally got my way, but it was infuriating and enough to make me not want to go back.
Over 40 minutes to get the worst, over salted, cat food gyro I've ever had.  Should have went to7-11, they have better service and better tasting mystery meat.

Went back to Philly Steak Express again because I was a bit underwhelmed the last visit.  I had to either get a REAL beef Philly Steak or at the very least try their much talked about gyro.

Ended up going with the gyro combo for $8.99 to go.  Comes with a gyro, fries & a soda.  Took a bit to get the order done but dang it smelled pretty good.  Got it home and luckily it wasn't a total disappointment.

Fries were delicious!  Yeah, I know, fries.  But their seasoning make them tasty as all heck.  The gyro itself landed right in the middle for me.  Granted the sucker was large, loaded!  The pita was nice & supple.  Meat was I think a mixture of beef & lamb so it was flavorful and was a decent portion.  I wish the lettuce was romaine instead of iceberg.  Tomato was ok but could have been cut smaller.  Red onions!  Raw red onions!  Philly Steak Express added what seemed to be an entire half of a red onion to my gyro!  They're lucky I love me some onions, but the wifey took one whiff and was like, "No thank you!"  Their tzatziki sauce leaves something to be desired though, it was bland.  I was hoping for more of a cucumber & dill punch, which really brings the flavor home on a good gyro.  Overall, the gyro could use some work but it's headed in the right direction.

Next time, I will definitely go for the damn Philly Steak!!

I've been to Philly Cheese Steak Express three times now, and there's a reason I keep coming back. The signature sandwich here is frankly awesome. The bread is the ideal combo of crusty and chewy, the cheese gets a nice even melt, and the meat is seasoned and cooked to absolute perfection. I've also had the salad, chicken fingers, rice and kabobs, and they're all good to great. 

So...why is this only a three-star review?

It's because the name of the restaurant is only three-quarters correct. Philly Cheese Steak? Absolutely. "Express"? Absolutely not. 

This place is only a few months old, but they still seem to be having a pretty serious problem with service speed. It honestly doesn't seem like they've mastered the fine art of "making more than one order at a time." I have never waited less than 20 minutes for my sandwich, fries, and soda. Which, even though the food is worth it, is kind of ridiculous. If you only have an hour for lunch, and you stop here? You're going to be VERY lucky to make it back in time. 

How long are you going to wait? Well, I'm here now. Waiting for a sandwich, fries, and a soda. And I've so far made a restroom trip, then sat down to wait...and I've written this entire review on my phone in in the amount of time I've been waiting: about 15 minutes. 

Okay...after another six minutes, I have my food. And it's gonna be delicious. But I remembered something else: This is also the third time in three visits that I've been handed my order, and had to remind them they hadn't given me the drink yet. 

So: Bottom line: Food is fantastic. But the service is consistently slow and spotty. So come here, but make time, and pack your patience.

It was a rocky start for these guys when they first opened. I'm glad they have persevered through the awkward period where everything that may go wrong goes wrong and some customers expect everything to be perfect as they are....
But still, this place has improved and serves really good food. 

I really like the owner, I can see that he really wants his customers to be happy and satisfied.

It's always good to visit here.

Wanted to try this place out today for lunch but they were closed at 12:30pm. Posted hours are noon til 9 pm. Felt like the time I went for soup in NYC at the soup nazi's place. His sign read be back in August but it was October. Anyhow got  to try Squeeze in instead.

Please post accurate biz hours.

They have really great food, however don't expect food to come out quick. Sometimes service is amazing and other times it's pretty meh. Still it's a really good food spot if you just want to chat and have lunch with someone.
The staff was very friendly and the place was clean and organized. The food was delicious! I got a gyro and it was very good. The price is also very good.
Good Philly Cheese Steak for $5.99    not the biggest, but good and hits the spot.  Simple menu with Philly Cheese Steaks, Gyros and Kabobs.

Ordered 10 wings hot and 4 fingers medium to go for $18. First off the price was pretty high but I thought the wings would be the bomb. No sauce on either order, when I got home I had to use Franks hot sauce to get some flavor. The guy added fries to both orders which I didn't ask for. My first time here and my last time.

I absolutely love this place! The food is delicious. I especially love their hot pastrami! AMAZING!!! The fries, the philly chicken and beef sandwiches are so good! My husband loves their chicken kabobs! All I can say is it's a must try! You have nothing to lose and everything to gain! The service is extremely nice as well. Family owned and operated. I come here at least once a week. ADDICTED!!!

Chicken philly rocks!  Service is ok and a lil slow but the food is good.  It's a convenient little spot to get in and out of.  My boyfriend had the regular philly and said it was salty.  They do salt the heck out of their food.  So be clear if you want them to stay lite on the salt.

The service is lacking, unfriendly and unappreciative.  Ive been in twice.  First time I had to explain what I wanted a few times and I asked for jalapeños in addition to the normal toppings. There was no immediate communication to the cook of my additional topping. When I got home I was charged for it but no jalapeños.  My second visit, I had to repeat my order 3 times and then once again directly to the cook (again no communication to the cook by register guy); I paid and had to ask for my change as the register guy took my money and immediately turned around and left; I ordered a combo which I again had to say 3 times, and no one gave me a cup for my soda.  So when I asked for my cup their response was, "so you didnt get it"?. Never a thank you or Im sorry I don't understand.  I give them a 2 only because the fries are good.  Won't be back.

The Philly Steak Express is a luxury I tend to treat myself to only on special occasions. Its an emotional relationship between me and the steak on the rare moments I am drained or I am PMSing. I have the craving I get in my car drive to the shop and binge away. I don't feel guilty afterwards. Its delicious.

First off I love the food here, it's always fresh and good. The staff is barely competent unless the owners are here. Today I ordered a sandwich plain and when I drive across town to pick it up naturally it's not plain. The girl is incredibly rude and says that she didn't hear me. Any of the regular staff knows my order but this chic acts like I'm lying, then the cook says to my why didn't you say something, MF I did. I'll be sure to make sure all my customers know about this experience.

Yum, yum, yummy!

First let me state that I have never eaten a cheesesteak in Philly, so I can't compare these to those.  What I can say is that the cheesesteaks I have eaten here are super tasty!  I have been here twice and I have enjoyed the cheesesteaks both times.  I even got a craving for one, which is why I ended up there the second time.  That should say something right there!

Both times I have been to this location, I had to get the cheesesteak combo.  For $7.99, you get a yummy cheesesteak, fries, and a soda.  It is just the right size for me and I totally pig out on that basket of goodness!  They season the meat with something that really sets it apart from other cheesesteaks I have had in the past.  It is almost like Cajun seasoning, but not quite.  It is really good though!  The fries here are super fat steak fries and come with seasoning on them as well.  They have been cooked perfectly both times.  I would go back for the fries alone!
  
My hubby really likes the gyros here as well.  The also do chicken options on the menu items, for those of you out there not into beef.  They also have wraps, kabobs and salads, so there is really something for everyone.  I haven' tried these items because I am in love with the cheesesteaks though.  YUMMY!
This place has the best quality Philly steak cheese sandwiches, which I believe is very hard to find out here in Vegas. Great customer!!  Every time I come here the food is ready fast and delicious!

My first thought was "ooo, a philly cheese steak sounds delicious". Their "Philly steak" sandwich is not a "Philly Cheese Steak". Though, it is a pretty delicious sandwich regardless. 

The meat has some sort of seasoning that tastes Moroccan or Mediterranean of sorts. I think they should just get rid of the "philly" name and just say "Steak sub". Also, there's a giant sign up front that says "foot long", but keep in mind that's different than what's on the menu. The menu doesn't really tell you that the sub is only a 6".

Also, having gyro, Greek salads, and kabobs gives the place a whole different feel than a traditional American steak sub place.

Overall, it's good food, but the concept is confused.

Stopped in on my way home after reading reviews. Ordered Philly steak with fries and drink. No mushrooms. 

Smelled so good on the way home I had to break into my to-go box and grab a fry!   Thick cut steak fries with season salt. Nice and crispy, not too greasy. 

Got home and dove into my sandwich. Everything was packaged to retain the heat. The steak was super tender. So tender, I am a little suspicious as to if it really is steak???  Meat cooked nicely to stay juicy. Onions were diced and caramelized. Bun was fresh. Cheese was abundant and pleasantly gooey!  Seasoned a little heavy with black pepper giving it a little kick, but I like it that way. 

All in all, good experience. Reasonable prices. The Philly comes in one size but it was plenty for me with leftovers. The place seemed clean and well kept. I'll be back to try more things in the menu but the steak is a winner!!

Food was really good.  They did make a mistake on our order but they made up for it without question ..... We didn't even complain.  I loved that it was very clean and bright and you could see how fresh the toppings were.  They had amazing customer service and with a smile.  The hot dogs were awesome very good quality,  the gyro was delicious. Even there version of the quesadilla was very good.  Thank you for the awesome service.  The only suggestion I would like to make is having crushed red pepper.. That would be the cherry on top.

This is a family owned restaurant and I loved the atmosphere ! I can feel the team work and Sophia was amazing ! I am very indecisive she was patient with me and smiled the entire time ! I will be back thanks to Sophia and her hospitality!

I can't get enough of Philly Steak Express. You'd think it would be for the Philly Steak but nah, it's the wings and fries! My second favorite when they're out of wings is a big fat burger. Yelp asked if they have dessert and I replied no, but I notice that someone is delivering an Italian ice custard in their display case. I've tried the Philly Steak and it's good and tender and I wouldn't hesitate to try it. The bad side to PSE is the ice machine is always on the fritz, come-on: just replace it already. Also the bathrooms look semi-sketchy. This restaurant reminds me of the east coasts restaurants that I've seen in the movies. Never had a chance to visit up there and I'm a Cali-girl by birth. This is my neighborhood food joint and my family loves it.

This place is great! I tried it one day after I left the nail shop and it has been great every time I go. They make everything fresh. The staff is always friendly and they treat you like neighbors. You can get a combo with fries or a salad.

I've been here a few times and it's always been good. Good food, good prices, close to the house. The first time I tried the hamburger and fries combo and it was great. You can see them cooking your food and it's obvious they do a good job at keeping things sanitary, I like that. The second time I tried the Philly Cheesesteak combo and it was fantastic, couldn't ask for better. Today I went in and thought I'd try the Gyro, John behind the counter said I would enjoy it, that it and the cheesesteak was their specialty. He was right, that was the best Gyro I ever had! Good job, John!
Try the Kabob and rice. Super tasty. Real middle eastern flavor at its best. The owner is very nice too and engaged in conversation with me. Overall a great lunch spot for sure.

This place offers a wide variety of food, from philly-steak sandwiches as the name indicates, to middle eastern kabobs and gyros. We came for the later stuff; we had a ground beef kabob platter and a beef gyro. Servings were pretty generous, the rice accompanying the kabob is one of the best we've had in a Mediterranean eatery in the area, and the kabob soft and well seasoned. The gyro was equally good. Service was friendly, it would be much better if customers were acknowledged and greeted when they arrived, with a smile if possible, instead of just staring at them.

Amazing philly steaks and Gyro's Definitely recommend this place! The staff is super friendly and helpful being my first time I didn't kno what to get and recommendations were delicious! Super clean inside also can't wait to come back!
This place is yummy. We've always ordered their phillys. Cheesy, meaty, and juicy. The fries are crispy and seasoned with season salt. The staff is really friendly and prices are great.

I tried them a few times when they first opened and I was far from impressed. The staff wasn't friendly or helpful and the food was usually over seasoned. I recently heard the original owner sold it so I decided to give them one more chance hoping new owners would know how to make better food. I'm happy to say I was right! The new owner is MUCH nicer than the previous, staff is friendly and the food is good! It's like night and day in a very good way!! Congrats to the new owner for doing a good job!

Delicious food! Tried the burger before & it was just as great as before as was the Philly ~ but the fries are SPECTACULAR!
My favorite kind (hard to find) seasoned perfectly steak fries cooked through so they're crispy & not greasy - yum!!!
Adorable kid working there is a business owner in training & does a great job. 
Keep up the Good work! With so many choices in the area it is quite competitive so I hope they'll be around for a long time.

Take a drive to Pops on Decatur. It beats this establishment. The guy threw on some Lawry's salt to the fries. C'mon. This place sucks. Another foreigner  guy trying to make a buck off us with a cook top. No skills or passion. Move on.

Such amazing Quality of food, everything has great favor. I enjoy the food here so much I drove 20 mins just to pick some up. The owner is also the nicest person you will meet here in Vegas. So please come down and try it all

I ordered the Philly Cheese Steak with fries and it was amazing. The fries were cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the Philly Cheese Steak is to die for. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. I will be trying the Kabob next time I'm in the area

First time here......haven't had a beef Philly in a long time.  Wow, this is exactly what I was craving.  The bread was so fresh and the sandwich was delicious.  Very friendly staff, too.  Quick, convenient, excellent service AND food...what more could you ask for?

I will definitely be back soon!!!!

I saw the sign for Philly Steaks and decided to stop and give this place a try.  I read some of the reviews prior to coming I and they were mixed so the best way to judge is to give it a try and form my own opinion.

They have salads, chicken fingers, kabobs, gyros and Philly Steaks, so a little different then what I experienced in the places it tried in Philly.  The staff here today was mother/daughter and not from Philly....

I was greeted right away and my order was taken.  There was a large order placed just as I came in and the service was pretty fast as they did not wait long for their order....

The steaks are prepared the way you see it in Philly which is a plus so far...

The combo which is what I ordered came with a 6 inch sandwich, so it was only half a sandwich and a small order of fries with a drink.  The steak does not taste the same as you would expect from a normal philly but it was ok.  The fries are like steak fries and you get maybe 10 fries, so it's not a big order and this meal will not fill you up for a long period of time but it will fill you up for a little while.  I would not rate this as the best but also not the worst,  I have had worse in this town.  

So in closing, using Philly in your name does not make this a traditional Philly Steak but it will work if you have nothing else available.
Amazing food and great service!!! I would absolutely recommend. Good selection of food--I ordered chicken kabob and they gave a big portion with rice and salad. I will be visiting again for sure

So. I've been to this place three times in two days. It's amazing. So delicious. The STEAK FRIES ARE SO FREAKING GOOD. They owner is so sweet, always gives me extra cheese and the location is very near my job and you can get a soda, fries, and the best Philly cheese steak in the world for $10. Go eat here.
Came in for a philly steak sandwich, and it was great.  We ordered the potato bites on the side.  The food is flavorful.  I'll be back to try more menu items in the future.

Food is great...and you know how I like my meat - HALAL. 
I've been here a few times so it's finally time for a review. 
Philly Steak Express is great for the halal fam except for it's a bit misleading...cause you can't even eat the Philly cheesesteak (it ain't halal!). I usually get the cheeseburger cause I'm the confused woman who is pretty damn basic. If the cheeseburger is good, that's when I know other menu items are too. 

PROS: 
1. Staff is nice! 

2. Separate bathrooms for both genders. 

3. Clean establishment. 

However, there are some CONS to this place. 
1. The menu says they are open till 10pm on Fridays and Saturdays - but we witnessed many customers who came in at 8:20pm being told that they close in 10 minutes. So why does the menu say otherwise? #pleasefixthis 

2. The menu items are just a tad overpriced when compared to other halal American food places in Vegas. If you wanna know which ones, check out my other reviews. 

3. If you get a fountain drink, there is a limit of 1 refill.
I don't understand how ppl give this place a rating above 3 stars. Ordered a chicken philly which was super salty and tasted like no other philly sandwich I've ever had, which isn't a good thing.

Random find, gave it a try and have been back twice.  The key to their success (beyond the food) is their willingness to custom prepare your food.  No request is too small.  Prices are fair and value is excellent.  Treat yourself to delicious Philly steak and incredible gyros!  Wish they would place the beverage fountain within customer reach.

Go try PSE.  You'll love it!

I found this place by accident while looking for a place to eat lunch.  When I walked in and nobody was eating inside or outside, I get worried!  I really wanted to get some kabob a try.  I ordered the chicken kabob with a salad to eat in the store.  The meal was large enough for two people!  The food was tasty and the portions large.  I would come back here again but try the beef kabob.

So I thought I'd give this place a try. Bad idea. Showed up 20 minutes after they opened and they still weren't ready. The gyro meat wasn't on the spit and warmed up so they had to cut it off and heat it up on the flat top. They also brought out the 5 gallon container of their yogurt dill sauce to fill up the line, which tasted bland and too liquidy.  Took 10 minutes to make my gyro. Took it home to eat and they put about a pound of white onions and mound of iceberg lettuce. I scraped about 3/4 of the onions and lettuce off because it fell off anyway. I could close it. And when I was able to it was soggy and fell apart anyway because of the water sauce. Save your money. Go up the street. I'm a little upset because it kinda ruined my lunch.
Love this place the Philly Cheesesteak are the best I had since visiting Philly. It was fast & fresh. The guys were nice. I only wished they delivered, but its worth the drive on a lazy day.

Can I get some sandwich with my salt please??   Sorry, but the sodium content of my sandwich probably shot my blood pressure through the roof.   But thanks for making the sandwich super meaty and using a soft hero bread vessel to store it on (no sarcasm even though it felt like it).  I just finished eating my 6 inch sandwich and my belly is satisfied.  So those keeping score at home, that's 1 for a filling tender meat sandwich but also 1 for hypertension.  Will I be back....   eh.   I'd say like 75% not.
It was one of best cheesesteak I've had in town. It was better then Capriottis  and cheaper. If you looking for real Philly cheesesteak this is the place to go.
Always hot and fresh. Cheesesteak & Gryos are freaking delicious and they aren't expensive. Yummmm!

My husband, daughter, and I went here on July 7, 2013. We had been waiting for it to open and were excited to try it. My husband got a steak wrap and I got a chicken wrap. Both were delicious, but especially the steak wrap. Both came with veggies inside, like sauteed zucchini, broccoli, and chickpeas. That was a huge, unexpected bonus. I assumed it would be a fatty, cheesy thing but it wasn't. Both were very large though, which is good or bad, depending on your perspective and the amount of self-control you have.

Major plus: they had a highchair.

Negative: they didn't have free cups for water. If you want water, you have to buy a sodia cup or a bottled water. That's a terrible way to save money, especially in Las Vegas.

I plan to go back!

Sadly I won't be back! Been here a few times for their gyro sandwich, today it was served on some overheated, old greasy pita! Barely ate much before I couldn't make myself eat anymore! Really sad, and this place isn't close to me so I drove a few miles for this rancid sandwich. Regretting that I ate as much as I did, feeling sick now!

Very very good Philly sandwiches Gyros And burgers highly recommend it.
It's our family's little spot close to home.
Nice clean but smokey place, inexpensive relatively. Great Philly Steak #1 . Check it out and try it.

Cheap, friendly, fast, locally owned. Can you ask for more? I got two #1s... Philly steak with mushrooms and onions no cheese with fries crispy. First they use real beef. Second real mushrooms. The have a house spice that adds a delightful tingle on your tongue. The bread was super airy... Almost a pretzel bun on the outside but lighter in the middle. The standard size is about. 8 inches of thick goodness! ( keep it clean people) comes with a medium serving of steak fries seasoned with their secret seasoning and a 20 oz coke product... All for $7.99. They have only been open two weeks but the owners are young and energetic. I love this little place and hope it flourishes!

This place was so yummy! The guy working was very friendly and gave my sister and I free drinks; the wait time was average but worth it. I love the philly cheese steaks here  my mom comes in all the time!

My parents and I came in for lunch in the middle of the week. We got a Philly Steak, Lamb Gyro, and Chicken Gyro. The staff was welcoming, and the food came out quickly (but still made-to-order!). Their meats are juicy and well-seasoned without being too salty. Each of us enjoyed our orders, but my favorite is the lamb gyro! I especially love that the gyro is from an authentic vertical rotisserie. The reason for 4 stars is that they put raw onion on the gyro that are pretty strong. I may ask if they can grill them next time.

Great food. Everything is made fresh to order. Everything is very hot when you get it.. Why people want warm food from fast food places over this I won't ever understand..  People have said its slow here but those people are the idiots I'm talking about. Used to fries and burgers ready as soon as they order it.  Great food decent prices. Only criticism is they need to turn up the AC.  Definitely going back.

I come here at least once a week with my boyfriend. I even came here on Christmas Day. Love the lamb gyros and chicken fingers. My boyfriend always gets the Philly steak. Everything is always 10/10. Kind of pricey for a combo but the portions are nice. It's a very laid back environment.

I tried this for the first time last night a friend wanted this to go. I can tell its a family owned business very nice people. I ordered the number 1 it was only 9 bucks for a combo that's not bad. My food came out very quick which is always a plus. I really like the seasoned fries and the sandwich was good just needed a little seasoning salt. I'd come here again.

I love this place!  We stumbled upon this little establishment when we saw a picture of a Gyro on their window.  I've had both their Philly Steak and the Gyro and they are made to order with fresh ingredients.  The combos come with a drink and steak fries.  The steak fries are seasoned with season salt, crispy on the outside, and soft in the inside.

Since moving to Las Vegas I haven't really found a good Gyro spot that makes em like Chicago (where I'm from). Chicago makes awesome Gyros and there is a place to get them on every corner.  Philly Steak Express hits the spot and I'm always satisfied.  

The guys that work there are down to earth people from Detroit.  I love their persona and the fact that they call everyone "bro". Based on the decor you feel like they really support the troops and the local surroundings.  If you are in the North West don't forget to try this little spot out!

Very good lunch place ! Average prices I expect to pay $10 for a sandwich , fries and a drink . More then enough food and pretty tasty ...I had the Philly steak  I will be back to try other things on the menu
Everything on the menu is delicious. You can't go wrong with any choice. Gyros, hamburgers, Philly steaks!!! Yum!

Ordered to go. Food was hot and ready when I arrived. I got the beef Philly combo. From some reviews I thought it would be a smaller portion but it was more than enough for me. The steak fries are big but I still got plenty. They were seasoned well as well as the Philly meat. The meat does have a bit of a kick to it but I didn't mind it all, slightly salty but still tasty. The cheese was super gooey like I like it. Overall I would return again to eat here!
I had the cheese steak with fries. It was fresh and hot. Good prices for the combo The lady working was very friendly and we will definitely return.

This is like judgemental service I've ever experience maybe it's just im wearing my sweater where I work @ .. i mean I'm here coz my bf wanted Philly steak and im just ordering and the lady was on the phone and just smiled , I ordered #2 the sandwich only and she ask me where I work @ since I'm wearing my sweater so I told her and she told me that "our gyros are better" and im like ok like I really don't care and then she added "customer says" and i responded ok since I don't care im just here to order food not compare and since I didn't order gyro I pretty much shut my mouth smh ..
Probably one of the best Philly sandwiches I've ever had. We got the chicken Philly, which I've never had before, and got it as a wrap, which I've never done, and it was bomb.com

I'd say 3 and a half. Food is always good but needs more FLAVOR and fries need to be cooked longer. Make your own ranch also.... much better tasting. Philly's are delicious though. Just need a bit more flavor. Employees are always super nice 2.

I was excited to try this place and came in with an Entertainment coupon. I ordered two Philly steaks and when I tried to use the coupon, the cashier pointed to his own coupon just like mine and written on it were the words, "We no longer accept Entertainment coupons!" He explained that they were under new ownership and not obligated to honor it. I was in shock as a frequent user of these coupons, this was a first. Businesses know these things pay for themselves and happily pay money to be in the Entertainment Book to attract new customers, and here this place is already in there for free, and is rejecting new business. How myopic can you get? I could have been a life-long customer as it's right by the school where I work. These guys have redefined stupidity and with such lack of business acumen, I don't see them lasting long.

The menu is simple. Its cheeseteak, wrap, gyro, kebob plate and chicken fingers. 

The BF and I got to-go for us and his mom. 

We shared :

Philly cheese steak - this was a pretty good cheese steak. I'm no Philly expert nor claim to be but I liked the soft rolls they use and the flavor was good. 

The BF got a combo which here comes with a drink and some steak fries. I saw complaints of them being over seasoned in previous reciews but these were not. Not much came to a order so I wish I ordered my own. 

Beef/lamb gyro - this was just OK. It wasnt bad but just had better ones. The meat was a tad salty. I think Ill grab cheesesteak too instead of us splitting these two sandwiches. 

Prices were inexpensive and its close by my house. The MIL loved her cheesesteak so Im sure our family will be back for more.

Okay so this place was new to the area and I decided to give it a chance. Shortly I realized my reasoning for NOT being open to trying NEW small food businesses in Vegas. There were about 5 people ahead of me and I waited 30 minutes for a "philly cheese steak" which actually turned out to be cheap, salty, fatty, Nitrate filled roast beef. No Peppers/onions, no REAL cheese, they use cheap white American cheese and little hoagies. The guy making the food prepared EVERYONE'S meals WITHOUT gloves, nor did he wash his hands (not that it matters, he even swiped sweat off his face) and he was the same guy behind the Register touching dirty money! I tossed the sandwich in the parking lot cus I didnt wanna make a scene over 4 bucks.  NEVER AGAIN!

Amazing that's all I can really say!! Hands-down you want the best Philly cheesesteak in Las Vegas forget Capriotti's forget pops this is the real deal I get the number one Philly cheese onions mushrooms fries with seasoning and a Coke under $10 very very good size of Philly tasty every bite worth it 100% best Philly in town

I like the gyros THERE but always in a hurry to get it out I like the meat well done. Seems To b a problem !!!!! But orders to go are never what r suppose to b this last time half the meat I usually get no lettuce no tomatoes and I only wanted no onion

Very salty and super greasy. The bread was okay. I'm disappointed that they didn't have provolone or mozzarella cheese and no green peppers.  The meat didn't have any taste other than salt. The fries were cold. There were about 3 pieces of mushroom.  I didn't wait long because I called it in thankfully.  I probably won't go back. The prices changed from the flyer they originally gave us a few months ago.  I am not impressed. I've definitely had better philly steaks from other places.

Only giving a star so I can leave a review. I would never come back here. The service was really slow and the cheesesteaks were not good at all. Both of us started to feel immediately sick. The fries were too raw on the inside as well. Being from Philadelphia this place does not even come close to what a cheesesteak should be. The rolls are elspggy and the meat is salty.

Ordered some takeout from this place...it wasn't bad...but it wasn't very noteworthy either.  A-OK is the right feeling behind the review.

Tried their Gyro sandwich and Gyro fries since my Sister was boasting about it.

The gyro meat here has an interesting taste...more like a skillet char vs the rotisserie style, but my sister said they do have the spit here.  It also seemed a bit on the salty side but overall enjoyable to eat.

The fries were pretty plain-jane boring though.  For gyro fries, they only added meat.  None of the cucumber/Tzatziki sauce, no veggies, nothing but plain meat on the fries.  And since I had the complaint above about it being a bit on the salty end, it was a little bit of a bummer.

At least the prices are very cheap though...nobody's gonna break the bank giving it a go.

I should come back and try their Philly Steak...after all, that is what they named their place after...presume that's what their specialty is!  I only ordered the Gyro since it was raved about :/

This is a good philly. Based on filling is how I usually judge Philly cheesesteaks. They use white american cheese but they're bomb. The price you also can't beat $10 you get 10inch philly fries and a drink. I'll be back for sure since it's in my side of town. As far as the bread goes I don't think it's bad but I don't think it's the best. I think this is just my opinion alone but if you can relate then cool I personally like a chewy toasted bread when it comes to phillys. But if you're going to use soft bread then I want it super fluffy and soft. If that makes sense. Still it's solid and they have other Mediterranean dishes too like gyros and stuff.

Outstanding!  Our favorite place to go for a Philly Cheese Steak sandwich and Burgers.  They serve steak fries with their own special blend of top secret  seasoning, it's out of this world.  Large portions for the price.

So far I tried the Philly cheesesteak and fries. I must say the bread was really good it seemed like it was steamed because it was really soft. The meat was good. However I don't really feel like it was a philly since it didn't have provolone cheese but American yellow cheese instead. Even still, it was pretty good. The fries are ok. Not a big fan of the seasoning.

One of the best cheesesteaks I've had since living in Las Vegas. They had my takeout order ready very quickly on a Sunday right before a playoff game. I will definitely be back for the cheesesteak combo.

Rude. I love this place they are so nice. Too bad theres one punk chef that wanted to scowl at me while he walks out the dining room wipes his sweaty forehead and goes to smoke a cigarette on the patio where clearly the business owner has placed a no smoking sign all the while messing up my order. Great cold and rushed food. And when my order is ready i asked if he owned the place. They said they are a family owned restaraunt. And i said well that guy sure acts like he owns it. Low class ill spend money elsewhere.

We literally just finished eating and are immensely pleased. We both got the beef philly steak, mine with no onions or mushrooms and the hubby had his with bell peppers added. Both were really good. We ordered the combos so we also were able to try the fries. The spice on the fries is delicious. I was worried it would be too spicy because of some reviews, but neither the philly nor the fries were spicy, they just had great flavor. My husband is picky on cheesesteaks and he really liked this one.

My only concern is that we didn't receive a receipt. My husband didn't even think about it until he got home and I asked for it to log in our budget. I saw a previous post stating that they were charging 8.5% tax when the tax should only be 8.15%. But alas, I cannot confirm or deny whether this is happening.

Overall a great meal, I just want receipts in future.
Military discount but they should remove the word express from their name. Kitchen layout is not most efficient.

This is a poor excuse for a cheesesteak the cheese steak was hard and overly greasy had no flavor the cheese burger tasted like rubber my knife what it even cut it I gave their food to my dog and she wouldn't even eat it

First time trying this place and I don't think I'll return. Paid about $20 for two gyro meals where the gyros were pretty inedible. Asked for no onions, which was followed. However, there wasn't sauce advertised on their photos, or at least not the pile of sauce I encountered mixed with far too much lettuce. The pita was low quality, soggy, and fell apart when I tried to pick it up. Only highlights being decent service and really good fries. Has a lot of potential, but this was not a great experience.

HORRIBLE SERVICE BEWARE!!!!!! I order to sandwich and asked the lady who took my order if there was any cucumber in the sandwich because I'm allergic to it, she replied No. Upon receiving my sandwich it looked ok, so I took a bite and noticed a tiny bit of cucumber  in the dressing, I immediately stopped and eating and told her there is cucumber in it, my lips began to tingle and itch and instead of saying sorry the man who made the sandwich argued with me about the stupid pic which didn't show cucumber and how "I just didn't like it" which I replied to say no, I'M ALLERGIC, he continued to argue about nonsense, my husband kept say no big deal she'll eat the other sandwich we ordered. What I find ludicrous is we had already paid, we weren't asking for a discount, just say sorry. The lady who even took my order even told him she didn't know that there was cucumber present. All in all, it's just bad business that could have resulted into a hospital visit.  When you mess up, and the customer nicely lets you know, don't argue with them and just say sorry. We defiantly not go back and make sure others know about them. Be careful!!!!!

We came upon this place accidentally, but we will be returning. Our food was prepared quickly, with all fresh ingredients in a super clean kitchen.  Our food was seasoned perfectly, the bread was perfect for the philly and the gyro sandwiches.

This place is absolutely amazing! They have gyros, chicken Gyros, shish kabobs, wraps, and the chicken is absolutely amazing. If you haven't eaten here, you need to stop and eat. I am a very picky eater and will not eat at many restaurant around Las Vegas due to their unsanitary nature or horrible Food Service. At Philly Cheese Steak Express, I get a variety of food that is absolutely delicious and freshly made! This place is as clean as it gets when it comes to restaurant standard. Stop by...you'll see!

I love their Philly Cheese steaks and my wife gets their lamb gyros. They are really good and fresh to order. This is a real hidden gem up in the Centennial area. If you want what time me tastes like a genuine Philly Cheeses steak you gotta try them out and they are super affordable.  I used to live around the corner and saw the ace but never went but now I am a fan and I love just down the way but I will definitely make this a frequent spot to eat at.
This is my favorite place for gyros and the white sauce was amazing. The staff was very pleasant and I would go back over and over.
Food was hot, fresh and very tasty!  Exceeded our expectations and we will definitely be back!

Let me start with the service, which was lacking. There were about five young people working behind the counter. The guy who took our order had no personality at all. There was no greeting, explanation of their menu, or even a smile. He asked what we wanted, without making eye contact, and set our trays on the counter and walked away when our food was up. It also appeared that the girl working in the back was wearing pajama pants. I am all for a laid back atmosphere, but pj's is a little too laid back for my taste. Now for the food. The menu is quite strange here. The menu options included Philly sandwiches, gyro, kabobs, burgers, hot dogs, and quesadillas. My boyfriend and I both opted for Philly's, as the name is what drew us here in the first place, and we were both equally disappointed. My sandwich was covered in so much pepper, I couldn't even finish it. My boyfriends sandwich on the other hand had absolutely no seasoning at all. The only enjoyable part of our meal were the fries, which were actually really tasty. We definitely will not be returning.

I've been meaning to try this place as it is close to the house. My daughters and I tried: Philly steak sandwich, gyro, and the youngest had chicken nuggets. We ordered combos with fries and sodas and the total came to $22 and change. The chicken nuggets were a bit disappointing but the gyro and steak sandwich were delish. My only gripe on the steak sandwich was that it had a ton of pepper on it, which I don't mind but the kids found distasteful. I've been back twice since the first time and haven't had the pepper issue again. I like being able to get a decent gyro on this side of town, so I will be a repeat customer.

I am not sure when they actually open but the sign was flashing open so we went in and it was a ghost town.  After standing there and moving the tables around to fit our family still nobody has greeted us or said I will be right with you.  The phone rang and we finally saw the first sign of life but still no acknowledgement to us standing in the restaurant.  So we decided to leave for a different place and I guess that jolted him into almost chasing us out of the store yelling for us to come back because he was really open.  I guess get there when you know people are already in there eating.

Been by here checking in on the cheesesteak n chicken n cheese. The food is decent in best terms, nothing to write home about but also not horrible. It's a good quick go to when trying to satisfy your craving for cheesesteaks.. I was a bit disappointed with the blah attitude of the employees every time I've stopped thru.. no smiles, no greetings, just took the order n Payment n that's it. Which is cool too but not too much incentive to rave about or compel me to continue to patronize this establishment. They use cheese sauce on sandwiches which isn't my fave at all..but in a crisis it will do for a ten dollar combo meal w fries n a drink

On my lunch break with my classmates and my friend ordered the chicken kabob and I had the gyro and it was only $6 and filled FILLED with quality yummy lamb and the lettuce, tomatoes and cucumber sauce we so fresh!   Thank you!   I'll totally be back!!!

I came here for lunch. I asked if they deliver the guy working said no. Then I saw there fly witch says they deliver. The service is okay not slow and not fast. The employee are not rude nor are they friendly. It was in a word blah service. However the cheese stake was good. 1 give the food a 4 and the service a 2
The manager is a so rude like seriously, the food taste old and overlooked each time  this place is weak
Just had a philly steak sandwich it was so delicious my mom had the chicken kabob I tried it too so good definitely coming back here
Family Owned business and you can certainly tell that they take pride in there restaurant. And also the food is absolutely amazing best Philly Steak I've ever had!

Checked this place out today. Was pretty busy at lunch time. But only took them about 5 minutes to cook my meal. I got fries, a drink, and a Philly cheesesteak. Very very good!! Will definitely come back here. Delicious food and quick service.

Really nice family owned establishment. Always very clean, guys behind the counter are super nice. Food is always delicious and they're never busy.  Great place to eat if you're lucky enough to find it.
Steak philly and Gyro were awesome. Great seasoning and served hot. Price was also reasonable and both meals came with fries. Guys working the counter were awesome. Definitely going back.

If I had to compare, this place beats Outback's philly cheese steak. I would recommend ordering the number 1 combo with extra cheese, extra onions, and extra mushrooms. This place is not that expensive and worth your money. It's very filling!
I really love this place. It's family friendly, clean, the food is great, and the prices are reasonable. I usually order the steak or chicken kabobs.

Love love love this place! I am from California and went to get my son a haircut and I could smell the food and I decided to drop in. When you first walk up they have a beautiful patio to eat. I side was clean and had several tables and the people were so nice and helpful. They took the time to get the order right. We sat outside and they brought the food and drinks to us. The food was amazing it was delicious. We had the number #1 philly steak combo with fries and drink, the fries were awesome they were seasoned and tasted delicious. The sandwich was amazing every bite was full of meat and cheese and all the goodies I asked for. Number one thing I look for when I go eat somewhere is the place clean, second is the people are they nice and friendly, third when I sit to eat the flavor of the food and portion size. This place has it all! Portions are great! I will definitely be coming here again!

Sitting in the restaurant right now with my gf, just had the beef philly with steak fries and also tried the chicken kabob with rice. The philly was good, but nothing special.. I feel that Pop's on decatur was a better philly cheese steak experience. Although this philly wasn't the worst I've had in town. Good for the price $5.99. 

As for the chicken kabobs, they were actually pretty good, nice flavor and very moist. The only setback is they aren't really kabobs, just chicken chunks on a plate. 

All in all good place.. but like other reviewers stated, be ready to wait a while for your food. Seems like the staff is more about joking around with each other rather than getting your food out quickly.
This is great halal restaurant. The meat is very tender & the service is brilliant. So glad to find it. Eiman is very sweet & personable. We'll be back here again for sure. Thank you so much.

This place is great! They have the best Philly cheesesteak sandwiches in town! They are always super friendly and all the food is made fresh to order. I was sent there by a friend to get food and ordered myself a sandwich and was blown away by how great it was! I would recommend to everyone they try this place at least once! You have no idea what you've been missing until you try the sandwiches here!

My wife and I tried this place for the first time. It was fair. The philly has mostly bread and not much of anything else. The fries were over seasoned and worse part soggy. My wife ordered the Kabob and it was 1/6 of the size that was pictured and didn't even come on a stick like pictured.  We weren't thanked at anytime or given a receipt for the purchase. The "cook" was arguing with someone about a sign and was taking phone calls while cooking on his cell and failing to wash his hands after. We won't be back.

I like their cheesesteak but this place gets 1 hour for the fact that EVERYTIME THEY ARE BUSY they have The worst customer service and it's the older taller lady. 

She answers the phone so rudely or doesn't answer at all. 

Why do you answer saying 1 hour wait time , it's like she wants to discourage you from spending money at her facility. 

Look woman if you can't take the heat get out of the kitchen. Have some professionalism for gods sake.
It was average food. My husband asked for no mushrooms on his Philly steak but it was loaded when we got home. My gyro was ok.

I gave this one star because the staff were rude. We walked in and stood there for a considerable amount of time, out of the three staff that were working  nobody bothered to acknowledge us whatsoever. We turned around and left and will never go back again.

My husband and I have ordered Philly Cheesesteaks with Mushrooms here 5 or 6 times and we LOVE them.  Don't care if they're not authentic, just that they're good and hot and they are reasonably priced.  No complaints at all.
Sharon and Mark

I ordered a chicken cheesesteak combo and my son had a burger combo. My chicken was seasoned and cooked well AND served on a wheat roll-two thumbs up in my book! My son likes his burger. I'm usually not a fan of thick cut fries, but these had a yummy seasoning. I can definitely see this place in our rotation! Both for under $20!

Stopped by for a quick bite to eat cause I've been hearing great things and the Yelp reviews. Couldn't have been happier. Being from the East Coast this was like being back home!!! The food was fresh and delicious and the counter help was very friendly and accommodating. If you're in the area stop by, you wont be disappointed. Can't wait to go back
Not a bad place to go at all. The food is fast good and well priced. I highly recommend it. Always stop here or when I'm on the northwest side of town in the Centennial Hills area.

One of my favorite regular visits for lunch or dinner small place with great food and personable service grilling everything fresh like kabobs and Philly steak sandwiches fries or rice is good, gyros, burgers and  fingers also available.  Lots of options to eat in a square mile around here but I prefer here.

Service is great!! They make you feel welcome as you walk in the door.
Amazing sandwiches! Looking forward to coming back soon :)
Thank you to the staff

So first off I've been coming here for over 5 years. This place doesn't have a single thing on the menu that I haven't ordered and loved! Best philly in town chicken or steak whatever your fancy. The Gyro is also phenomenal, you can get it traditionally or as a wrap or salad. Kids meals also so come down and feed the family! The owner and all the workers are extremely courteous and take pride in what they serve. I tip most times I can when I come by but I figured that this review should help them more than my measly few dollars. I'll be back again very soon, thanks!
Best Philly I've had in Vegas there French fries are crispy and seasoned well! I will definitely be back!

I ordered the chicken philly cheesesteak combo. It was so tasty. Fresh mushrooms and onions. The seasoning on the French fries is amazing and it's not to overwhelming! The fries are wedges freshly cooked. The portion size is perfect too! I will be back!
This place is awesome. I had the Philly cheesesteak, my boyfriend had the gyro. Both were DELICIOUS! We'll definitely be back.
Cheese steaks were the best I've had in Vegas. Totally worth the 20 minute drive. Soda machine was out of ice and co2. Once that was fixed, everything was good!
They have a great Philly Cheese Steak!  The salads & kabobs are also really good.  This is a great little lunch/dinner spot.
